summary: This is a press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the death of Jeffrey Epstein by apparent suicide at the Manhattan Correctional Center. The statement reaffirms the office's commitment to its ongoing investigation into sex trafficking of minors and urges victims to come forward.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the official statement on behalf of the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding Jeffrey Epstein's death and the ongoing investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The accused who faced federal sex trafficking charges and was found dead in his jail cell of an apparent suicide.

connections.description: Berman, as the U.S. Attorney, was the lead federal prosecutor overseeing the criminal case against Epstein.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center and pronounced dead shortly thereafter of an apparent suicide.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died by apparent suicide in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019.
Epstein was facing federal charges brought by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York for sex trafficking of minors, which included a conspiracy count.
The U.S. Attorney's Office stated its investigation into the conduct charged in the indictment remains ongoing despite Epstein's death.
The statement is directed at Epstein's victims, urging those who have not come forward to contact authorities.
